Fourier Sum

f(t)=a02+∑m=1∞amcos⁡(mωt)+∑m=1∞bmsin⁡(mωt)f(t) = \frac{a_0}{2} + \sum_{m=1}^{\infty } a_m \cos (m \omega t) + \sum_{m=1}^{\infty } b_m \sin (m \omega t)f(t)=2a0​​+m=1∑∞​am​cos(mωt)+m=1∑∞​bm​sin(mωt)

Fourier Coefficients

a0=2T∫0Tf(t)dta_0 = \frac{2}{T} \int_0^T f(t) dta0​=T2​∫0T​f(t)dt
am=2T∫0Tf(t)cos⁡(mωt)dta_m = \frac{2}{T} \int_0^T f(t) \cos (m \omega t) dtam​=T2​∫0T​f(t)cos(mωt)dt
bm=2T∫0Tf(t)sin⁡(mωt)dtb_m = \frac{2}{T} \int_0^T f(t) \sin (m \omega t) dtbm​=T2​∫0T​f(t)sin(mωt)dt

Rewriting with Eulers Formula

f(t)=∑m=−∞m=∞cne−imωtf(t) = \sum_{m=-\infty}^{m=\infty} c_n e^{-im\omega t}f(t)=m=−∞∑m=∞​cn​e−imωt
cm=1T∫0Tf(t)eimωtdtc_m = \frac{1}{T} \int_0^T f(t) e^{i m \omega t} dtcm​=T1​∫0T​f(t)eimωtdt

For Non-periodic Functions

f(t)=∫−∞∞g(ω)e−iωtdωf(t) = \int_{-\infty}^{\infty} g(\omega)e^{-i\omega t} d\omegaf(t)=∫−∞∞​g(ω)e−iωtdω
g(ω)=12π∫−∞∞f(t)eiωtdtg(\omega) = \frac{1}{2\pi}\int_{-\infty}^{\infty} f(t)e^{i\omega t} dtg(ω)=2π1​∫−∞∞​f(t)eiωtdt

Periodic boundaries

If the function

f(r)f(\bm r)f(r)

is such that

f(r)=f(r+LR)f(\bm r) = f(\bm r + L\bm R)f(r)=f(r+LR)

[For some positive integer

LLL

and lattice vector

R\bm RR

. Then/Får något positivt heltal

LLL

och gittervektor

R\bm RR

. Då håller att]]

f(r)=1V∑k=GLck⋅eik⋅rf(\bm r) = \frac{1}{\sqrt{V}} \sum_{\bm k = \frac{\bm G}L} c_{\bm k}\cdot e^{i\bm k\cdot \bm r}f(r)=V​1​k=LG​∑​ck​⋅eik⋅r
ck=1V∫Vf(r)⋅e−ik⋅r d3rc_{\bm k} = \frac 1{\sqrt{V}}\int_V f(\bm r) \cdot e^{-i\bm k\cdot\bm r}\: d^3rck​=V​1​∫V​f(r)⋅e−ik⋅rd3r

Where

G\bm GG

is the reciprocal lattice vector and

V=L3∣a1⋅(a2×a3)∣=L3VaV = L^3|\bm a_1\cdot(\bm a_2\times\bm a_3)| = L^3V_aV=L3∣a1​⋅(a2​×a3​)∣=L3Va​

. The functions

1Veik⋅r\frac 1{\sqrt{V}}e^{i\bm k\cdot\bm r}V​1​eik⋅r

is a complete orthonormal basis in

VVV

.. If the volume

VVV

is large, the sum can be replaced by an integral:

∑k→V(2π)3∫d3k\sum_{\bm k} \rightarrow \frac V{(2\pi)^3}\int d^3kk∑​→(2π)3V​∫d3k

Dirac Delta Function

∫ABf(x)δ(x−x0) dx={f(x0)if  A<x0<B0otherwise\int_A^Bf(x)\delta(x - x_0)\: dx = \begin{cases} f(x_0) &\textup{if}\; A < x_0 < B \\ 0 &\textup{otherwise} \end{cases}∫AB​f(x)δ(x−x0​)dx={f(x0​)0​ifA<x0​<Botherwise​

If

f(x)f(x)f(x)

is a "nice" function.

δ(f(x))=∑∀i;f(xi)=0,f′(xi)≠01∣f′(xi)∣δ(x−xi)\delta(f(x)) = \sum_{\forall i; f(x_i) = 0, f'(x_i) \neq 0} \frac 1{|f'(x_i)|}\delta(x - x_i)δ(f(x))=∀i;f(xi​)=0,f′(xi​)=0∑​∣f′(xi​)∣1​δ(x−xi​)
δ(x−x0)=12π∫−∞∞eik(x−x0) dk\delta(x - x_0) = \frac 1{2\pi}\int_{-\infty}^\infty e^{ik(x - x_0)}\: dkδ(x−x0​)=2π1​∫−∞∞​eik(x−x0​)dk

Kronecker Delta

δn,m=12π∫−ππeiϕ(n−m) dϕ={1n=m0n≠m\delta_{n,m} = \frac 1{2\pi}\int_{-\pi}^{\pi} e^{i\phi(n - m)}\: d\phi = \begin{cases} 1 & n = m \\ 0 & n\neq m \end{cases}δn,m​=2π1​∫−ππ​eiϕ(n−m)dϕ={10​n=mn=m​
